title: Europa Village 2014 C'est La Vie Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Napa wine by a Temecula producer is very fruity on the nose, with smashed red fruit and stewed blackberry aromas most prominent. There is decent acidity to the sip, but the flavors lean toward prunes and very extracted fruit flavors.

title: Fox Farm 2014 Syrah (Rogue Valley)
description: Syrah is trying to find a foothold in Southern Oregon but seems to be prone to developing chewy, earthy tannins, as is the case here. Brambly berry fruit and tart acidity combine to give a sharp, crisp and astringent impression.

title: Garzón 2017 Reserve Albariño (Uruguay)
description: This Albariño's flowery, tropical aromas are oily and suggest cured ham. Its plump palate is cut by lively acidity, framing melon, honey, fennel and salami flavors. The finish, though lasting, is chunky and tastes a bit salty.

title: Gorrebusto 2016  Rioja
description: This wine's grapy berry aromas bring good vinegar to mind. Its raw, fresh palate is firm and far from fat and cushy, with briny plum and berry flavors. It has a hard grape skin-like texture on the finish.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (South Coast)
description: Clean aromas of ripe nectarine and Anjou pear skins meet with lime pith, cut grass and cement on the nose of this bottling from the San Diego area. An impressive texture grabs hold of the palate immediately, then gives way to baked apple and dried pear flavors that go down easy.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: The watermelon and soft strawberry tones of strong on the nose of this bottling. There is a good sizzle of acidity and textural grip to the palate, where rounded and soft bubblegum flavors thrive.

title: Integrity 2016 Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Peachy aromas meet with Key lime pie and grapefruit pith on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp in texture and citrusy in flavor, if a tad sour.

title: Iron Horse 2015 Thomas Road Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: High toned in forest floor, cranberry and rhubarb, this wine shows a thickness on the palate and complexity of dried herb and cardamom that persist with abandon.

title: J. Bouchon 2015 Block Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)
description: Dry, earthy plum, tomato and spice aromas open this prickly Cabernet Sauvignon. On the palate, rough tannins and pronounced acidity make for an edgy mouthfeel. Tart, saucy flavors of plum and red currant finish with a savory, tomato finish.

title: Kirkland Signature 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Candy cane and cherry aromas lead to easygoing strawberry and cherry flavors in this wine. Its not very complex but still provides appeal.

title: Kramer 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This dark rosé is principally Pinot Noir, with 9% Pinot Meunier. It's cherry-red in color and blocky strawberry and raspberry flavors, with hints of lime-like acidity. There's no lack of fruity flavor here; it's just a bit top-heavy.

title: Le Masciare 2016  Fiano di Avellino
description: Acacia, chamomile, tropical fruit and a whiff of roasted nut aromas lead the nose. On the linear palate, fresh acidity brightens pear, pineapple and hints of bitter almond.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Mansois  (Marcillac)
description: Packed with red fruits, soft tannins and an easygoing ripe texture, this wine has red-cherry and strawberry flavors. Balanced acidity gives a wine that is light, poised and ready to drink. One of a series of Osmin wines made to highlight lesser-known varieties of Southwest France, it will make a fine summer red.

title: Martin Freixa 2014 Old Vines Carignan (Montsant)
description: There's a definite cooked, stewy element on the nose of this Carignan. The palate is also baked in style but has with a shot of angular, tomatoey acidity. Earthy plum and spice flavors finish with meaty notes and a final burst of acidity.

title: Mitolo 2015 Jester Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Ripe, almost raisiny fruit mingles with notes of pine resin, vanilla, mocha and slightly sweaty oak on the nose. The palate is rich and equally raisiny, with soft, slightly flabby tannins. Overall there's a heaviness to this wine that's calling out for more freshness and drinkability.

title: Naggiar 2016 Mistero Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Medium bodied, smoky and fruity, this wine has lively acidity and light tannins that carry the raspberry and red-cherry flavors well without any noticeable oak influence. It's leaner than other recent vintages. Best after 2020.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: This fragrant off-dry Riesling is a charming flurry of white blossoms and plush pink grapefruit. Ripe and easy in demeanor, it's a mouthwatering sip with delicate integrated sweetness on the finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Pedroncelli 2014 Wisdom Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Muted aromatics open slowly to unfurl herbal components of cedar and dried herb in this estate wine, blended with 4% Petit Verdot. Medium-bodied highlights of graphite and cassis are strong.

title: Poggio Bonelli 2015  Chianti Classico
description: This opens with aromas of red plum and baking spice. It's straightforward, with black cherry, clove and ground pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins.

title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Reserva Syrah (Tejo)
description: Almost black in color, this is a rich wine. Layered tannins keep the bold black fruit in check and balance. Spice and toast underline the fruitiness of this wine. Just wait until 2019 to drink.

title: River Road 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This is majority stainless steel fermented, offering a highly floral experience that's steely and stony on the palate. Vanilla and melon flavors expand on the broadly defined body of the wine.

title: River Road 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fermented in both oak and stainless steel tanks, this wine invites in jasmine and apple blossom aromas before offering supple and substantial layers of creamy vanilla, baked apple, melon and oak.

title: Rolling Plains 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Extremely fruity and relatively light in body, this exuberant wine is easy to quaff. The strawberry and cherry flavors are so ripe and fresh they taste sweet, and the texture is soft and full with very little tannin.

title: San Vincenti 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and baking spice lead the nose. It's straightforward, with black cherry, bell pepper and clove flavors.

title: Sanguinhal 2015 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Obidos)
description: Ripe and almost sweet in its jammy fruitiness, this wine comes from a small appellation in Lisboa centered on the medieval city of Obidos. Its red fruits and acidity have a soft character, melded by gentle tannins. It is ready to drink.

title: Sanguinhal 2016 Quinta de S. Francisco Branco White (Obidos)
description: Crisp, tangy and zesty, this wine, dominated by the very local Vital grape, is cool, brushed by ocean breezes. Its acidity and cut of minerality are delicious and refreshing. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of Bosc pear, fresh citrus and a pinch of chalk show on the nose of this bottling. The wine hits the palate with a riper sweetness that washes into zesty wild lime rind flavors.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Petris Vineyard Bien Nacido Clone Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: This wine has stewy plummy flavors of dried and baked fruit that's dusty and textured on the palate. Sanguine, soft and simple, it lives up to its varietal character within a full-bodied voluptuousness.

title: Viña Casablanca 2016 Cefiro Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: This wine's spicy, leathery red fruit aromas are earthy and medicinal, with a hint of iodine. Light in body, it offers modest oak, fresh acidity and plum, cherry and cocoa flavors. The finish is lean, peppery and dry.

title: Vinum Autmundis 2015 Umstädter Stachelberg Kabinett Halbtrocken Riesling (Hessische-Bergstrasse)
description: Ripe yellow-apple and peach flavors are touched by a hint of honey in this plush, delicately off-dry Riesling. It's a clingy expansive wine with sunny acidity offset by a firm phenolic grip. Drink now.
